oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Simple white building with a sign above the front five windows that reads, "Dyer Rosenwald School."
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Education Schoolhouse Photos, 1938-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This school had fifty-five students enrolled, two teachers, two classrooms, and was in session for eight months per year. The principal was W. L. Burnett. He taught grades 5-8, and Mrs. Carrie Skinner taught grades 1-4. The report issued by the Department of Education indicate that areas of deficiency, among others, included the school's scholastic record, community-mindedness, opportunities for athletic and cultural experiences, and science and shop.
